Natural Language Processing

A book on Natural Language Processing by Jacob Eisenstein, covering topics such as learning and knowledge, search and learning, relational, compositional, and distributional perspectives.

Key Concepts:

  • Linear Text Classification
  • Bag of Words
  • Naive Bayes
  • K-means clustering
  • Semi-supervised learning
  • Multi-component modeling
  • A sentence expressing the concept of regular languages
  • A sentence expressing the concept of context-free languages
  • A sentence expressing the concept of finite state acceptors
  • Classification
Natural Language Processing Machine Learning Text Classification machine learning unsupervised learning expectation-maximization regular languages formal language theory context-free languages finite state acceptors
